title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX Most Likely Doesn’t Pay Taxes
summary: Elon Musk’s rocket company relies on federal contracts, but years of losses have most likely let it avoid paying federal income taxes, according to internal company documents.

title: What Could Happen at the Trump-Putin Summit, and a Game of Chicken Over Voting Maps
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: How Trump’s Meeting With Putin Could Unfold, as Trump Seeks Cease-Fire in Ukraine
summary: A sudden feud, an impasse or a first step toward a cease-fire are all possible at the summit in Alaska as the two leaders navigate thorny issues such as Ukraine’s territory and NATO expansion.

title: Trump-Putin Meeting: What Time, Where and How to Watch
summary: The leaders of the United States and Russia will hold talks at an American military base in Alaska and are expected to hold a news conference afterward.

title: Why Russia Sold Alaska to the U.S.
summary: The Trump-Putin summit will take place in a former Russian colony that the United States bought for $7.2 million in 1867. Here’s how the deal came together and why its legacy matters.

title: What to Know Ahead of the Trump-Putin Summit
summary: We have a primer on today’s Trump-Putin summit in Alaska.

title: Bondi Tightens Trump Administration’s Grip on D.C. Police and Names ‘Emergency’ Commissioner
summary: The attorney general cleared the way for the police to aid in immigration enforcement and named an “emergency” commissioner, setting the stage for a conflict with local authorities.

title: Feds Turn Into Beat Cops in Trump’s D.C. Policing Surge
summary: In the nation’s capital, federal agents have operated a sobriety checkpoint, made gun and drug busts and carried out other day-to-day police work. Some residents are uneasy.

title: Draft of ‘Make America Healthy Again’ Report Suggests RFK Jr. Won’t Push Pesticide Regulations
summary: The report is not final, but indicates good news for the food and agriculture industries.

title: They’re Losing Their Vision. They Still Love Playing Tennis.
summary: For the visually impaired people who participate in blind tennis, the sport delivers joy. “This is what I’ve been missing,” one player said.

title: The Last Refugees Let Into the U.S. Wonder if Their New Country Wants Them
summary: After President Trump suspended the refugee admissions program, some new arrivals found themselves out in the Wisconsin cold. With help, they have survived.

title: Tariffs Are High. So Is the Stock Market.
summary: Strong corporate earnings, mostly stable tariff rates and the expectation of interest rate cuts have eased worries of a market reckoning.

title: China’s Economy Slows Broadly Even as Exports Keep Rising
summary: Officials blamed U.S. “protectionism” for the dismal July data, but growth was likely held back by real estate and new policies aimed at slowing factory investments.

title: Why Hands-Off Investing Pays Off
summary: Put money into low-cost stock and bond funds, but don’t forget the rest of the recipe: Leave your investments alone.

title: Tribal Colleges Rely on Federal Funding. Their Leaders Fear the Trump Years.
summary: As the Trump administration has publicly targeted elite universities, it has also quietly pursued funding cuts for the nation’s tribal colleges, which rely on federal dollars to operate.

title: Thousands Ask Harvard Not to ‘Give in’ and Pay Fine to Trump
summary: In a petition, alumni, faculty and members of the public asked Harvard to stand up to the White House. The school has signaled a willingness to pay $500 million to restore research funds.

title: PBS Slashes Budget by 21% After Federal Funding Cuts
summary: The nonprofit will receive less revenue from its members, which are under pressure to make up for shortfalls of their own.

title: Sarah Jessica Parker on ‘And Just Like That ...’ and Carrie Bradshaw’s Legacy
summary: The “Sex and the City” revival reached its bittersweet end this week. Does the actress like where Carrie Bradshaw landed? “Absolutely.”

title: ‘And Just Like That …’ Series Finale Recap: My Everything
summary: The “Sex and the City” revival ended on an empowering but bittersweet note for Carrie and the crew … and also with Barry White.

title: Even as ‘And Just Like That . . .’ Ends, Carrie Bradshaw’s Clothes Live On
summary: Throughout the beloved series “Sex and the City” and its reboot “And Just Like That …,” the protagonist’s wardrobe was the most reliable through line.

title: Trump’s Attempt to Make Museums Submit Feels Familiar
summary: MAGA would fill museums with self-glorifying kitsch, the aesthetic lingua franca of all authoritarians.

title: Boy Crisis of 2025, Meet the ‘Boy Problem’ of the 1900s
summary: It takes a village to raise a child. But some of the villagers must be men.

title: Seth Meyers Braces for Trump’s Kennedy Center Honors
summary: The president said “wokesters” in the performing arts wouldn’t be honored. “A ‘wokester’ sounds like a car your great-grandfather drove after the war,” Meyers said.

title: With a Shovel and a Dream, Woman Finds 2.3 Carat Diamond in Arkansas
summary: After three weeks, with bug bites and tattered hiking boots, Micherre Fox found the stone at Crater of Diamonds State Park.

title: Evo Morales, Barred from Bolivia’s Election, Urges Null Votes
summary: Despite being barred from running again for president and being sought for arrest, a towering figure of Bolivian politics is trying to rally supporters to cast null votes.

title: Jackie Bezos, Jeff Bezos’ Mother and an Early Amazon Investor, Dies at 78
summary: Ms. Bezos and her husband invested about $245,000 in Amazon when the online bookstore was in its first year.

title: Flash Floods in Pakistan Kill at Least 60 People in a Single Day
summary: The country has faced heavier rain during monsoon seasons, which scientists have attributed to climate change.
